sen.j: 膳 摩漏（かしわでのまろ、生年不明 - 天武天皇11年7月18日 (旧暦)（682年8月26日））は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: KASHIWADE no Maro (date of birth unknown - July 18, 682) lived during the Asuka period in Japan.
KASHIWADE no Maro (date of birth unknown – August 26, 682) lived during the Asuka period of Japan.
sen.cmt: 新暦が載っているので新暦に直します。
sen.e: KASHIWADE no Maro (date of birth unknown – August 26, 682) lived during the Asuka period of Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「かしはでのまろ」。
sen.e: The reading of his name in the old Japanese syllabary characters is "KASHIWADE no Maro."
According to the old Japanese syllabary characters, it is considered that his name had been pronounced as 'Kashifade no Maro.'
sen.cmt: 誤訳です。飛鳥時代、は行は「ｆ」音で発音されていたので「kashifade」となります。オリジナル著者がこの文章を入れたのは発音の違いを示すためです。「旧仮名遣いで」という説明はこの著者以外使わないと思われますが、正しく訳すと左のようになります。
sen.e: According to the old Japanese syllabary characters, it is considered that his name had been pronounced as 'Kashifade no Maro.'
Kabane (hereditary title) is Omi.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Omi.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Omi.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）の側についた。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War, he fought on the side of OAMA no Miko (Emperor Tenmu).
In the Jinshin War, he fought on the side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, later became Emperor Tenmu).
In the Jinshin War, he fought on the side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, later became Emperor Tenmu).
Conferred posthumous honours of Daishi.
He was given posthumously the rank of Daishi.
sen.cmt: スタイルを統一します。
sen.e: He was given posthumously the rank of Daishi.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』によれば、天武天皇11年（682年）7月9日に、小錦中の膳摩漏が病となり、天皇は草壁皇子と高市皇子を遣わして見舞いさせた。
sen.e: According to "Chronicles of Japan," on July 9, 682, Shokinchu KASHIWADE no Maro fell ill, and the emperor had KUSAKABE no Miko and TAKACHI no Miko visit him.

According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), on July 9, 682 (in old lunar calendar), Shokinchu KASHIWADE no Maro became ill, and the emperor sent KUSAKABE no Miko and TAKACHI no Miko to visit him.

According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), on July 9, 682 (in old lunar calendar), Shokinchu KASHIWADE no Maro became ill, and the emperor sent KUSAKABE no Miko and TAKACHI no Miko to visit him.
Maro died on the 18th.
Maro died on the 18th (in old lunar calendar).
Maro died on the 26th.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 天皇は驚き、とても悲しんだ。
sen.e: The suddenness of his death affected the Emperor greatly.
The emperor was shocked and mourned over the loss greatly.
sen.cmt: オリジナルに近いかたちにします。
sen.e: The emperor was shocked and mourned over the loss greatly.

sen.j: 21日に壬申の年の功によって、天皇は大紫の位と禄を摩漏に贈り、皇后（後の持統天皇）も物を贈った。
sen.e: In recognition of his achievement in the year of Jinshin, on the 21th, the emperor sent the rank of Daishi and special salary, and the empress (later Empress Jito) sent him gift(s) as well.
sen.cmt: 禄＝奉禄(位禄など)=special salary とした。
sen.e: On the 21th (in old lunar calendar), in recognition of his achievements in the year of Jinshin, the emperor gave Maro the rank of Daishi and special salary, and the empress (later Empress Jito) gave him gifts as well.
On September 1, in recognition of his achievements in the year of Jinshin, the emperor gave Maro the rank of Daishi and special salary, and the empress (later Empress Jito) gave him gifts as well.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 大紫は壬申の功臣の中でも高位だが、書紀が壬申の乱を述べるくだりに摩漏の名は見えないので、どのような活躍をしたかはわからない。
sen.e: Daishi is the highest rank as a meritorious vassal of Jinshin, however there is no description of Maro in the article of the Jinshin War in Shoki (Chronicles) therefore how well he performed is unknown.

Daishi was a relatively high rank among ranks given to meritorious vassals of Jinshin, however there is no description of Maro in the article of the Jinshin War in Nihonshoki, therefore how well he had performed is unknown.
sen.cmt: 誤訳、時制ミスがあります。
sen.e: Daishi was a relatively high rank among ranks given to meritorious vassals of Jinshin, however there is no description of Maro in the article of the Jinshin War in Nihonshoki, therefore how well he had performed is unknown.
